definitions.definition: To be concerned (about), to have an interest (in); to feel concern (about).
examples: She doesn’t care what you think.
I don’t care , I’m still going.

definitions.definition: To want , to desire ; to like ; to be inclined towards or interested in.
examples: Would you care for another slice of cake?
I don’t care to hear your opinion.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , polite , formal , chiefly in the negative

definitions.definition: To be affected by, to treat as relevant for a subsequent course of action .
To look after or look out for.
examples: Young children can learn to care for a pet.
He cared for his mother while she was sick.

main_definition: ( transitive , intransitive ) To be concerned (about), to have an interest (in); to feel concern (about).
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , polite , formal , chiefly in the negative ) To want , to desire ; to like ; to be inclined towards or interested in.
( intransitive , informal , by extension ) To be affected by, to treat as relevant for a subsequent course of action .
( intransitive ) (with for ) To look after or look out for.
( intransitive , Appalachia ) To mind ; to object .
